articles.author: Maayan Lubell, Maya Gebeily, Laila Bassam
articles.description: Israel's security cabinet is expected to convene later on Tuesday to discuss and likely approve the text at a meeting chaired by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
articles.title: Israel poised to approve ceasefire with Hezbollah, Israeli official says

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: President-elect Donald Trump's team is discussing pursuing direct talks with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, hoping a fresh diplomatic push can lower the risks of armed conflict, according to two people familiar with the matter.
articles.title: Exclusive: Trump team weighs direct talks with North Korea's Kim in new diplomatic push, sources say

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken has agreed to testify publicly at a House of Representatives committee hearing on the 2021 withdrawal from Afghanistan, the panel said on Tuesday, after a long dispute with the Republican-led committee.
articles.title: After long wrangling, Blinken to testify in Congress on Afghanistan

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Lidia Kelly
articles.description: Russian forces have taken an area half the size of London over the past month, analysts and war bloggers say.
articles.title: Russia accelerates advance in Ukraine's east

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel and Lebanese armed group Hezbollah are set to implement a ceasefire on Wednesday as part of a U.S.-proposed deal for a 60-day truce to end more than a year of hostilities.
articles.title: What does the US-brokered truce ending Israel-Hezbollah fighting include?

articles.author: Asif Shahzad, Gibran Peshimam, Charlotte Greenfield
articles.description: Pakistan's security forces launched a sweeping midnight raid on supporters of jailed former Prime Minister Imran Khan who had stormed the capital demanding his release on Tuesday, local media said, with hundreds arrested amidst chaotic scenes.
articles.title: Pakistani forces launch midnight raid on ex-PM Imran Khan's supporters, local media reports

articles.author: Ricardo Brito
articles.description: Brazil's Federal Police found proof that former hard-right President Jair Bolsonaro plotted a coup to overturn the outcome of the October 2022 election he lost to leftist challenger Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, the police investigation report said.
articles.title: Brazilian police report implicates Bolsonaro in coup plan

articles.author: Anna Mehler Paperny
articles.description: Canada's immigration minister says he plans to propose measures to reform the country's refugee system, potentially fast-tracking refusals of cases deemed to have little chance of succeeding.
articles.title: Canada hints at fast-tracking refugee refusals

articles.author: Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: Chile launched a preliminary investigation into a sexual harassment complaint against President Gabriel Boric on Tuesday in a blow to his leftwing administration that is grappling with a separate scandal involving sexual abuse and low poll ratings.
articles.title: Chilean prosecutors probe sexual harassment complaint against president

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Peru's Congress removed Energy and Mines minister Romulo Mucho from his post on Tuesday amid protests from small-scale miners in the Andean nation.
articles.title: Peru's Congress removes energy and mines minister amid sector protests
